private_information: I can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I
I can only move blocks that are at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Coordinate with the consonant agent to help achieve the global stacking goal by moving vowel blocks when they are topmost and when dependencies allow.

private_information: I can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J
I can only move blocks that are at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Coordinate with the vowel agent to help achieve the global stacking goal by moving consonant blocks when they are topmost and when dependencies allow.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' reports and produce a final PDDL domain and problem encoding suitable for FastDownwards that achieves the global stacking goal while preserving each agent's action restrictions.

public_information: There are blocks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Blocks are arranged in stacks on a table and only the top block of each stack can be moved at any time.
Each agent can move at most one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to interact only with vowel-labeled blocks and the other only with consonant-labeled blocks.

Initial configuration: F is on the table, A is on top of F, D is on top of A, I is on the table, G is on top of I, E is on the table, J is on top of E, B is on top of J, H is on top of G, C is on top of H.
Goal configuration: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on the table.

report.system_prompt: You are the vowel agent. You can move only vowel-labeled blocks A, E, and I. You may only manipulate blocks that are currently at the top of a stack and you can move one block at a time. Based on the public information and your private knowledge, produce a clear step-by-step sequence of moves that you can perform toward the global goal. Do not output PDDL. If moves require coordination with the consonant agent, indicate those dependencies explicitly.
report.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Using the public information and your private information, provide a move sequence you can perform. List moves as actions such as move(A, from_stack_X, to_stack_Y) and mark any dependencies on consonant_agent moves.

report.system_prompt: You are the consonant agent. You can move only consonant-labeled blocks B, C, D, F, G, H, and J. You may only manipulate blocks that are currently at the top of a stack and you can move one block at a time. Based on the public information and your private knowledge, produce a clear step-by-step sequence of moves that you can perform toward the global goal. Do not output PDDL. If moves require coordination with the vowel agent, indicate those dependencies explicitly.
report.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Using the public information and your private information, provide a move sequence you can perform. List moves as actions such as move(B, from_stack_X, to_stack_Y) and mark any dependencies on vowel_agent moves.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the reports from the vowel and consonant agents and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner. The PDDL must model two agents with distinct action sets that reflect the vowel and consonant manipulation restrictions. Include predicates such as on, on-table, clear, and agent-specific move actions. Enforce top-only movement and single-block move behavior in preconditions and effects. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the public information and the agents' reports to build a complete PDDL domain and problem encoding for the global goal. Ensure agent actions remain distinct. Provide the PDDL domain between <domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility.
